newsitem.title: UK: Manganese Brown H1 profits pull away.
newsitem.headline: Manganese Brown H1 profits pull away.

text.p: London taxi manufacturer Manganese Bronze Holdings Plc said on Monday it drove its profits higher in the first half and said it expected the trend to continue.

The company announced on Monday that pre-tax profit for the six months to January 31, 1997 had jumped 62 percent to 4.10 million stg. It raised its interim dividend payout to 3.50p per share from 2.50p.

"Trading in taxis remains very strong and well ahead of last year," said chairman Hugh Lang in a statement. "Provided market conditions remain similar, we expect to continue the profitable development of the group in the second half year."
Manganese Bronze said it was consistently producing 68 vehicles a week with good demand for both new and second hand vehicles.
It said its components division was continuing to make overall progress and noted that its precision castings business order book has increased "substantially" in recent weeks.
